string_table.str: Unlock by progressing through the campaign.

Infantry staging area. Troops and their support equipment arrive in the Outpost at the Raid Camp, where warriors can stoke their bloodlust before battle and thralls are penned while they wait for a mission. The Raid Camp allows the requisition of infantry and unlocks their upgrade options. Multiple Raid Camps in an Outpost reduces infantry requisition time. Raid Camps serve as a combination of briefing room, feasting hall, and place of judgment, and only warriors are allowed full movement within. During battle each one is a riot of activity, with battle roars and the cacophony of Brutes jostling each other while they don battleplate and test the blades of their weapons on the Grunts or each other.

Multi-purpose staging area for Strongholds. These bases define the win conditions of the Strongholds mode. Each Stronghold has infantry, air, and vehicle support structures already attached. Capturing Strongholds increases population capacity. Atriox sees little value in simulation training, preferring to blood his warriors in actual combat. Pain and fear are the best teachers, for what price is there to failure in the sterile realm of simulations and shadow-enemies? However, there are occasions when monitoring and screening are useful in identifying recruits that have the talent needed to lead Banished forces, and what better test for a new Banished lieutenant than a Stronghold on the chaotic front line?

Defense emplacements. Weapon towers around the Outpost deter attack from the UNSC, Sentinels, and rival overseers who hope to capitalize on momentary weaknesses. Most Outposts can fit up to four Turrets. Each Turret can be upgraded to be more effective against aircraft, vehicles, and infantry. Unlike UNSC turrets, these upgrades can be combined. Banished turrets start as moderately effective defensive structures, but they can be improved as time and resources allow. Canny overseers do not attempt to upgrade every turret to its full potential all at once, instead taking advantage of momentary surpluses and keen tactical analysis to upgrade based on current threats. Fully upgraded Banished turrets are extremely deadly, and only the most foolish UNSC commander would run directly at a fully upgraded defense line. But do not assume the Banished will be content to wait behind their turrets, Atriox commands that the best defense is always a good offense.
Unlock by progressing through the campaign.

Aircraft landing pads and hangars. Airpads are firebase support structures that allows the requisition of Hornet, Nightingale, and Vulture flyers from the Spirit of Fire and unlocks their upgrade options. Multiple Airpads in a firebase reduces flying vehicle requisition time. Expeditionary airpads house the maintenance crews and equipment needed to assemble, repair, refuel, and rearm UNSC aircraft. Airpads also support the force commander with sensor feeds and intelligence uplinks which allow for proper battlespace deconfliction, kill chain assignment, and other aerospace management tasks.

Expansion outposts. Minibase outposts have an armory for equipping basic infantry, and slots for one, two, or three additional support buildings. Minibases are deployed from Condors to opportunistic locations in the operations zone. Each minibase is built using stripped-down modules assembled and packed aboard the Spirit of Fire before being loaded on the dropship for deployment. Minibases that survive a battle become unmanned sensor and communication relays in the ever-growing system of control nodes being extended across the Ark by Isabel and Captain Cutter.

Artillery turret. Siege Turrets are long-range artillery systems built to counter enemy bombardment platforms that would otherwise be out of range of standard Turrets. These structures occupy a turret slot. The UNSC learned the dangers of relying on fixed installations against enemies with orbital fire support early in the war against the Covenant. The modular firebase system was developed in response to pinpoint Covenant targeting of large military command and control installations with orbital strikes, and the inability of standard counterbattery systems to detect, deflect, or defeat plasma-based artillery bombardment. The siege turrets can do little against threats in the orbital high ground, but they will deter enemy artillery systems by matching or exceeding their range, making ad-hoc assaults on UNSC firebases a costly proposition.

It has been three months now since we established the outpost, and each day we wake up to some new shift in our surroundings as its Sentinels repair and rebuild the Ark around us. I have witnessed dense forests spring up from pit-black, barren terrain over the span of a week and monitored a particularly virulent strain of weed checked by the reintroduction of voracious, insectoid parasites before it could strangle the budding plants nearby. (2/3)
A Split Heart is Easily Conquered
The Snake that Eats the Tail
The Healing of Old Wounds I
The Healing of Old Wounds II
The Healing of Old Wounds III
A New Bridge to Cross I
A New Bridge to Cross II
A New Bridge to Cross III
Unlocked by collecting in the campaign.
Unlock by progressing through the campaign.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'A New Enemy'.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'Ascension'.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'One Three Zero'.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'The Cartographer'.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'Lights Out'.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'From the Deep'.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'Hold the Line'.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'Under the Dark'.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'The Foundry'.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'The Halo'.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'Last Stand'.

The wreckage of a Covenant freighter lies scattered across the amber wasteland. This hostile environment, blood-red and battered by harsh winds, is rendered even crueler by the scorched and smoking remains of a Covenant freighter, blasted out of the sky by Forerunner defenses. The impact trench created by the crash leads down into a deep crater, where the force of the collision has destroyed the top layer of the refugia, revealing the proto-Forerunner substructure running underneath.
Unlocked by finding a collectable in 'The Signal'.
Unlocked by collecting in the campaign.

A translucent amber-like material covers much of the terrain in this unforgiving Refugia. Petrified rivers and lakes form vast, planar surfaces which are only broken by the angular, jutting rock formations that puncture the surface.
Fractures that have splintered into deep chasms reveal the complex Forerunner infrastructure below, and geometrical veins from these underlying structures can be seen striping the upper layers. In places the strong but brittle amber has sheared and degraded into sand, which is then whipped up and sculpted by the wind into dune seas where life struggles to take root.
What life can survive here is extremely alien; huge and bizarre flora spring up through cracks in the rocks, swaying in the breeze and belching spores into the atmosphere if disturbed.

The Foundry is a massive circular machine situated at the epicenter of the Ark for the purpose of constructing and repairing the ringworlds that make up the Halo Array.
Within its center it holds a mineral-rich moon in a powerful gravitational field that is mined for resources by giant Retriever Sentinels, then used by Assembler Sentinels to build components of a Halo. The Halo Array is always made of seven ringworlds and should one be destroyed the Ark starts building a replacement.
Once a Halo is stable, it is released to the same location as the destroyed Halo to replace it while Sentinels continue to work on it. Of the seven ringworlds that make up the Halo Array, six have originated on the Ark, while the seventh was constructed on an earlier version of the Ark and later reconstructed to fit the new design.

The Ark was originally created to build Halos, gigantic weapons that wipe out all sentient life in order to starve the parasitic Flood of life to infect. This desperate measure conflicted with the Forerunners' roles as custodians of the galaxy, and so it was decided that the Ark would also preserve examples of doomed species so they could be reseeded once the Flood had been eradicated.
The surface of the Ark was divided up into vast refugia sections, twelve on the Central Hub and twenty across the large, petal-like Spires that extend out from the center. Each refugia recreates the environments of common life-supporting worlds and separates sub-environments with by huge walls monitored by Sentinels to protect one ecosystem from polluting another. The Ark monitors and controls weather, temperature and even natural food chains in order to maintain the habitat.
Unlock by progressing through the campaign.

Vicious and cunning warmaster of the Banished. Leader and creator of the Banished, Atriox is a fearsome warrior who rose to power through his fierce tenacity and shrewd strategic planning honed during the Human-Covenant conflict. Atriox holds an extremely pragmatic view of warfare and understands the importance of supporting infrastructures and how to build armies and structures cheaply and efficiently. His charisma and the fervor of his followers make it possible for Atriox to deploy both savage Brutes and Elite mercenaries simultaneously, whereas other leaders would struggle to control such bitter rivals on the battlefield.

Fast scout armed with twin plasma cannons. Exclusively used by the Shipmaster and Arbiter for their speed and firepower, Ghosts are single-occupant anti-grav speeders armed with twin plasma cannons and the ram ability to decimate enemy infantry squads. Ghosts can also negate control over resource nodes. With the ghost shield upgrade the Ghost becomes a significantly more durable and effective high-speed raider. The Ghost is one of the most recognizable and ubiquitous vehicles on the battlefield. It is less armored than its Brute counterpart, the Chopper, but this sacrifice grants it nearly unmatched speed. This speed makes it useful for harassing and hit-and-run tactics on the field.

Expendable minions (and they know it). Though derided as cannon fodder, there is no mistaking the military value of having an almost endless supply of cheap infantry armed with plasma pistols to hurl at a foe. Each Grunt squad is led by a Brute armed with a spike rifle who can be upgraded to plant a cloaked proximity-fused shrapnel mine on the battlefield. The Grunts can be upgraded to add a pack brother and lackeys. Grunts may not be strong, brave, intelligent, hygenic, or particularly fearsome warriors, but those forced to serve the Banished have a healthy enough fear of their Brute leaders to stay on-task and motivated. Even if their fellows are used as target practice by bored Brutes or disintegrated by Forerunner sentinels, the survivors can at least look forward to a full food nipple and a brief nap in the methane atmosphere they call home.
Superheavy deployment platform. The Banished have appropriated Lich transports and repurposed them to function as carriers for the central command structures of their raider bases.

Siege walker. Locust walkers are siege vehicles armed with an unstable focus cannon that deals continuous damage to buildings and vehicles. Locusts are fitted with energy shields but are relatively fragile once those shields are depleted. One of the many Covenant vehicles modified by the Banished to serve their needs, the Locust is a walker unit originally built for mining and excavation purposes. The Covenant repurposed Locusts to demolish enemy buildings and outposts with sustained bombardment from their focus cannons, but the Banished have managed to make these vehicles even more dangerous than they were before.

Superheavy assault walker with devastating excavation beam. Few weapon platforms strike as much fear into an opponent as Scarabs. Massive and armored with nearly impregnable battleplate, most battles end soon after a Scarab appears. Banished Scarabs are armed with an unstable plasma beam that deals incredible ground-target damage and Thrasher missiles for air defense. The Scarab is slow but very mobile and can easily travel up cliffs and across rough terrain. Scarabs are highly prized excavation vehicles, though in Banished service they are almost exclusively used as war machines. Heavily modified by the Banished to maximize firepower, the unstable plasma generators used in these Scarabs quickly kill the Lekgolo worms that form its control system. Atriox cares not for this sacrifice as long as the Scarabs continue to bring him victories.

Forerunner Sentinels that can be called in by Anders to cause area denial. Though their primary purpose is to maintain, repair and protect the Ark, these Forerunner Sentinels can be summoned by Professor Anders, who has found a way to deploy them in the service of the UNSC. Once called, the Sentinels swarm in to a targeted location and attack any hostiles in the area with sentinel beams, remaining and causing area denial for a duration before returning to their jobs on the Ark. Any Sentinels that are destroyed emit an EMP blast, crippling hostile vehicles temporarily. The Sentinels are worker drones with basic AI, created by the Forerunners to safeguard their stations as well as perform repairs and maintenance. There is a large variety of Sentinels in both purpose, size and appearance. There are small Constructor drones used to maintain Forerunner structures, huge Retrievers used for mining and Aggressor drones for attacking any perceived threat. The Sentinels will only attack if they perceive a present threat; otherwise they will happily ignore strangers and carry on with their work.

Genetically augmented humans wearing MJOLNIR armor, the ultimate super-soldier. Spartans are the crack infantry unit of the UNSC - tough, fast moving and equipped with a rapidly recharging energy shield when not in combat. Their enhanced agility and strength enables them to leap high into the air before slamming into the ground, either to take out an enemy, place an explosive device on an enemy structure or even hijack a vehicle. Spartan Alice-130 can be upgraded to heft a medium range, rapid-firing heavy machine gun. Alice-130 grew up on the way station colony of Passage, where she amazed her family by quickly learning rudimentary engineering at an early age. This exceptional aptitude marked her out from the rest of the children and she was flagged up as a potential candidate for the SPARTAN-II program. Like all the candidates, she was abducted from her family for secret training, but she was one of the few children who weren't traumatized during the process. In fact, Alice actually relished and thrived on the challenge, a natural Spartan if there ever was one. Despite eagerly embracing her destiny, Alice's body initially rejected the augmentation process and she had to be retrained separately, where she met similar 'wash outs' Douglas-042 and Jerome-092, her future partners in Red Team. Alice lives for combat and challenge and can often appear reckless, but this is in actuality an utmost belief in her abilities.

Genetically augmented humans wearing MJOLNIR armor, the ultimate super-soldier. Spartans are the crack infantry unit of the UNSC - tough, fast moving and equipped with a rapidly recharging energy shield when not in combat. Their enhanced agility and strength enables them to leap high into the air before slamming into the ground, either to take out an enemy, place an explosive device on an enemy structure or even hijack a vehicle. Douglas-042 can be upgraded with his specialist weapon, which is a long range, slow firing rocket launcher. Douglas-042 had a tough time adjusting to the SPARTAN-II program as he had originally come from an affluent family in Khetleya on the Asphodel colony. He found the sudden culture shock difficult to adjust to, but soon focused that anger into a quiet confidence in his physical ability - even among the other Spartans Douglas is considered something of a giant, and he started to believe that he had a purpose in life. This faith in destiny has given Douglas more of an optimistic outlook in life than the guarded cynicism common among other Spartans, and it is this hopefulness that helps lift their spirits in hard times.

Military transport dropship. A workhorse of the UNSC, Pelican dropships are used by military and civilian agencies throughout human space. Produced in bewildering numbers with dozens of major variants they form the backbone of all medium-lift operations made by the Spirit of Fire. Though they can be used to hot-drop troops and vehicles to a combat zone, the ever-present threat of Banished anti-aerospace cannons deployed near conflict areas means Captain Cutter has strictly limited their tactical utilization.

Main battle tank. The Scorpion is armed with a high velocity cannon for anti-tank work and a medium machine gun for engaging enemy infantry. Scorpions in the field can be upgraded with submunition canister shells that deal heavy damage in a blast radius around their target. The Spirit of Fire carries a large complement of M808S Scorpion tanks modified by Serina during the years in which the ship drifted in space. Her improvements include a more efficient armor arrangement, better situational awareness for the operator, and upgrades to the main cannon. Isabel has found little room for improvement on this blueprint, but she sees possibilities for specialized variants that leverage the chassis for other roles.
Reduced cost and build time for all base and turret types.
Further reductions to cost and build time of bases and turrets.
Faster movement speed of all non-hero infantry.
Fires a wide lane of missiles at the battlefield.
Further increases damage, lane length, and ignites drop area.
Jump Pack Brutes drop Trip Mines when in flight.
Reduced cost & build time to all base and turret types.
All base & turret types are even cheaper and faster to build.
Makes Cloaking Generator and Shrouds cheaper. Marauder gains cloaking.
All cloaking abilities last longer. Shroud's cloak field is larger.
Infantry and light vehicles gain increased sight range.
Makes Ghosts, Wraiths, Choppers and Marauders faster.
All units gain damage boosts when they kill enemies.
All units gain a permanent minor health siphon when they damage enemy units.
All units have a permanent increase to speed and damage.
Affected units gain health when attacking.
Increases targeting size, duration, and siphon amount.
Further increases targeting size, duration, and siphon amount.
Affected units gain a damage and speed boost. Drains health over time.
Increases targeting size and combat effects. Same health drain.
Further increases targeting size and combat effects. Same health drain.
Fires a powerful player-controlled beam at the battlefield.
Further increases beam area and damage.
Drops Decimus into battle in his combat exoskeleton.
Teleports enemy units anywhere within range.
Teleports selected units to your main base, heals them on arrival.
Can teleport more units. Increased healing amount.
Can teleport even more units. Further increased healing amount.
Fires a controllable vortex which stuns enemies and lowers their defenses.
Inreases vortex size, and debuff strength and duration.
Plasma mines cost 30% less, Spirit Assault costs 30% less.
Gives a cloaking abliity to Marauders.
Faster capture speed for all units. Infantry sight range increased.
Allows Ghosts to capture points. Vehicles sight range increased.
Makes Ghosts, Wraiths, Choppers and Marauders faster.
Drops a cloaked vision providing mine onto the battlefield.
Increases mine damage and vision range.
Gives a cloaking ability to Ghosts.
Adds one more Jump Pack Brute. Upgrades and fully vets up all squads.
A Spirit provides cover fire and drops off an Elite Ranger, a Hunter, and 2 Engineers.
Creates a healing area. Gives brief invulnerability.
Increases area size, healing amount and duration.
Further increases size, healing, duration and invulnerability.
Longer-range teleport for more of your own units.
Drops a veteran Cyclops into battle.
All of your units gain a temporary health siphon, speed boost, and cloak.
Affected units ignore their own deaths and continue to fight for a short time.
Drops a cluster of cloaked mines onto the battlefield.
Heal all buildings and units in the targeted area.
Further increases size, healing, and duration.
Drops an ODST squad into battle.
Drops veteran units: 2x Cyclops, 2x ODST, 1x Scorpion, and 1x Wolverine.
Calls in Pelican Gunships to sweep a large area.
Drops a cluster of cloaked mines onto the battlefield.
Faster capture speed for all units. Faster movement speed of all non-hero infantry.
Allows Jackrabbits to capture points. Even faster movement speed of all non-hero infantry.
Drops mines around newly captured points, slows enemy decap rate. Jump Pack Brutes drop Trip Mines when in flight.
Creates a healing area. Gives brief invulnerability.
Increases area size, healing amount and duration.
Further increases size, healing, duration and invulnerability.
Place two connected teleporation nodes. Can be used by all players.
Upgrades and vets up the Grunts. Adds one Jump Pack Brute squad.
Teleports own units within a set range.
Drops a temporary turret into battle.
Renders all deployed units invulnerable for a set time.
Allows Atriox to build both Brute Warlord and Elite Honor Guard hero units.
Unlocks the Protector Sentinel for purchase at base.
Call in three waves of Sentinel Protectors to sweep across the map.
Call in six Aggressor Sentinels to guard an area for a period of time.
Increased duration and area. Adds two more Aggressors.
Further increased duration and area. Adds another two Aggressors.
Transports owned units anywhere within range.
Takes temporary control of targeted enemy vehicles and aircraft.
Affected units gain increased defense at the cost of speed.
Increases targeting size, defense boost, and duration.
Further increases targeting size, defense boost, and duration.
Clones targeted units to fake out enemies.
Can clone more units. Decoys last longer.
Turret Drop, Med Drones and Lotus Mine cost 10% less.
Kodiak and Siege turret attacks now summon friendly Aggressor Sentinels.
Fires a large kinetic slug at the battlefield.
Further increases impact size and damage.
Fires a modified MAC round which disables mechanical units.
Reduced cost and faster build times for all upgrades. Turrets gain shields.
Further reduced cost and faster build times for all upgrades. Improved Turret shields.
Even further reduced cost and faster build times for all upgrades. Further improved Turret shields.
Scorpions & Nightingales gain shields and more health. Increases Scorpion canister shot size.
Adds more sentinels to Sentinel Beacon and Ark Defense. Upgrades all Protector Sentinels.
While active, the first eight non-infantry units you lose in combat will respawn at your home base.
Vehicle production is cheaper and faster.
Vehicle production is even cheaper and faster.
Fires a powerful player-controlled beam at the battlefield.
Unlock leader powers by spending leader points

@D-Pad@ (DOUBLE TAP)
Select and focus on group
@Left_Bumper@ Hold down to access control groups on D-pad
@Left_Stick@ (Double-tap) Snap towards nearest units of base

@D_Pad_Left@ (LEFT) Jump to base
@D_Pad_Right@ (RIGHT) Cycle control zones
@D_Pad_Down@ (DOWN) Cycle to next army
@D_Pad_Left@ <font color='#00d4ff'>(LEFT)</font> Toggle units and buildings info

Double-tap a direction button to select and focus on a control group
Hold a direction button to create a control group with selected units
Tap a direction button to select a control group
For more information, visit us at https://www.halowaypoint.com/en-us/games/halo-wars-2

Halo Wars 2 is a fast-paced strategy game with epic battles set in the Halo universe. Build massive armies of diverse units and use their unique abilities to out-think and out-manoeuvre your opponents.

There's a lot to explore in Halo Wars 2, but don't be intimidated. Start with the Tutorials to learn the basics and then jump into the Campaign to discover the secrets of the Ark with the Spirit of Fire.

When you finish mastering the Campaign, it's time to test what you've learned in Multiplayer. There are different modes to try, including the Versus AI playlist where you team up with other players against AI opponents.

Finally, for an interesting twist on strategy games, jump into Blitz - action-packed battles where you collect and play cards to deploy units. Build decks and keep adapting them to outwit other players.
If you need to grab every unit quickly, double-tap Right Bumper to select All Units.
Your units will automatically gather nearby resources or attack enemy units.
Some units and bases can be cloaked. You can see the shimmer of a cloaked enemy, but if you want to attack them, you'll need a detector nearby.
Read the radial menu descriptions to learn more about units and upgrades.
Keep an eye on your leader points, shown to the top-right of the minimap. If you have any points spare, make sure you spend them.
Some units are support units and don't have weapons, but they are important for keeping your units alive.
Every unit has a set of coloured icons in the radial menu or on its Blitz card to indicate what they're strong against. Use these as a rough guide when deciding what to use.
If your opponent is using too many of a single unit type, punish them with a force of counter-units!
Leader powers can change the course of a fight. If you unlock active powers, remember to use them from the leader power radial menu.
Units gain veterancy as they fight on the battlefield, making them far more effective than new units. Try to keep them alive and they will return the favor.

Halo Wars 2 is an action-RTS (real-time strategy) game. In Campaign, Multiplayer and Skirmish, you'll have balance managing your economy, army and leader powers as you take the fight to the enemy. The battle dynamics will frequently change on the fly, so knowing the basics will help you to adapt and react.

The core of the economy in Halo Wars 2 are supply and power. You can gather these by constructing certain buildings in your base or by collecting them from objects in the levels. Supply is required to purchase buildings, train core units, and is the primary cost of most specialist units. Power is used to purchase upgrades for units, buildings and is an addtional cost for certain units. As a general rule, if you have enough supply, you'll always be able to field a competent army and, with enough power, you can make that army more lethal and focus on your strengths.

Though there are two factions in Halo Wars 2, both armies work in similar ways. Most units in Halo Wars 2 have a rock-paper-scissors relationship with each other, i.e., vehicles are effective against infantry, air units are effective against vehicles and infantry are effective against air units. Certain units break these rules - these are counter units, which have an edge against specific unit types, but are dangerously weak against everything else. As a general rule, you should aim to have a good mix of unit types, but beware of what your enemy is using.

Leader Powers are your most powerful weapons in the game. During each campaign mission and multiplayer match, you'll earn leader points. You can spend these in the leader power radial (accessed with the Left Trigger) to unlock active and passive leader powers. Passive powers will provide a constant boost to your armies once unlocked while active powers need to be used from the radial at the expense of supply and/or power resources. Each leader has unique mix of powers, so spend some time exploring each of them - you'll find defensive boosts, healing auras, and even powerful offensive attacks that will wreck havoc on an unsuspecting foe.

Are you an aerial ace or do roll with heavy armor? Test your tactical expertise and unlock new medals by competing in the 'Victory of the Skies', 'Victory of Armor,' or 'Victory of Land' challenges by winning a match using an army built only of air, vehicle, or infantry units.
New %1 DLC is in the store. Check it out and expand your tactical possibilities.
The old season is dead. Long live the new season. All playlist ranks have been reset, so head back in to Multiplayer or Blitz and set a new and better rank than last season.
Ranked playlists are now live. Jump into Multiplayer or Blitz and play with the new playlists to get a rank. Keep playing and winning to achieve the best rank you can.
Jump into Multiplayer for a limited time shot at our newest playlist. Have a go and let us know what you think at Halo Waypoint.
The game you know and love has just gotten a whole lot better. The update is live and in-game. Check out the patch notes on Halo Waypoint or jump into the game and see for yourself.
Thanks for playing Halo Wars 2. We hope you really enjoy the game. Join us on Halo Waypoint to give us your feedback as we look ahead to make it even better.

In 'Windowed' or 'Windowed (Fullscreen)' modes, set whether the mouse cursor should be confined to the game window or not.
Enable this option to make the d-pad buttons manipulate control groups by default, and move global shortcuts to advanced controls.
Turn this option on to enable ease of access shortcuts, and turn it off to disable them.
Enable this option to reverse the camera movement direction when you move the mouse with the middle mouse button held down.
Set the speed with which the camera scrolls when you move the mouse to the edge of the screen.
View and change mouse and keyboard controls.
Toggle scrolling the screen as the mouse cursor approaches the edges.
Adjust the speed at which the camera scrolls when the mouse cursor is at the edge of the screen
Adjust the sensitivity of the mouse cursor.
Adjust the speed at which the camera scrolls.
Enable or disable the ability to deselect units by clicking on empty space.
Swap the functionality of the analog sticks.
Enable this option to move fast camera movement to @LTRG@ and put Leader Power/Card hand access onto @LSHOU@.
Enable this option to make mouse wheel control zoom by default, and move unit sub-selection to @TutAlt@ + @MouseScroll@. The option has no effect if mouse wheel is rebound to an alternative function.
Play the game with keyboard and mouse.
Toggle the AI advisor for custom matches vs AI opponents. The AI advisor will offer helpful suggestions and hints.
Choose the default difficulty of AI opponents for custom matches.
Enable or disable battlefeed notifications in the HUD. The battlefeed provides notifications and alerts during battle.
Adjust the default zoom level of the camera.
Toggle minimap rotation. If on, the minimap orientation will remain fixed even when rotating the camera.
When a base you own is on-screen, open the radial for main HQ building.
When a base you own is on-screen, open the radial for the plot 1.
When a base you own is on-screen, open the radial for the plot 2.
When a base you own is on-screen, open the radial for the plot 3.
When a base you own is on-screen, open the radial for the plot 4.
When a base you own is on-screen, open the radial for the plot 5.
When a base you own is on-screen, open the radial for the plot 6.
When a base you own is on-screen, open the radial for the plot 7.
When a base you own is on-screen, open the radial for the plot assigned to %1.
Ease of access input text box
Add the selected units to Control Group 1. (Blitz)
Add the selected units to Control Group 10.
Add the selected units to Control Group 1. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Add the selected units to Control Group 2. (Blitz)
Add the selected units to Control Group 2. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Add the selected units to Control Group 3. (Blitz)
Add the selected units to Control Group 3. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Add the selected units to Control Group 4. (Blitz)
Add the selected units to Control Group 4. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Add the selected units to Control Group 5.
Add the selected units to Control Group 6.
Add the selected units to Control Group 7.
Add the selected units to Control Group 8.
Add the selected units to Control Group 9.
Add the selected units to control group %1.
Open the chat in the menus
Chat with other players currently in your squad.
Open the chat in all players mode
Chat with all players in the game, regardless of what team they're on.
Open the chat in team mode
Chat with all players on your team only.
Create Control Group 1 with the selected units. (Blitz)
Create Control Group 10 with the selected units. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Create Control Group 1 with the selected units. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Create Control Group 2 with the selected units. (Blitz)
Create Control Group 2 with the selected units. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Create Control Group 3 with the selected units. (Blitz)
Create Control Group 3 with the selected units. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Create Control Group 4 with the selected units. (Blitz)
Create Control Group 4 with the selected units. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Create Control Group 5 with the selected units. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Create Control Group 6 with the selected units. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Create Control Group 7 with the selected units. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Create Control Group 8 with the selected units. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Create Control Group 9 with the selected units. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Create a control group with the selected units and assign them to %1.
In Blitz, cycle a card that is currently selected.
Move the camera to and between your base locations.
In Blitz, move the camera to and between the control zones.
Move the camera to and between your armies.
Cycle to next empty base plot
Move the camera to and between your empty base plots.
Move the camera to and between your hero units.
While holding down this key, enable camera dragging with mouse movement.
While holding down this key, increase all camera scrolling speeds.
Set the position of the global rally point. All recruited or constructed units will move to this location once production is complete.
Select and move the camera to the units assigned to control group %1.
Move the camera to the location of the last alert. (Blitz)
Move the camera to the location of the last alert.
Go to the location saved to %1.
Tap to select your on-screen units. Double-tap to select all units.
View the objectives in campaign or allied status in multiplayer.
Open the Objectives menu in Campaign or the Score screen in Multiplayer/Blitz.
Ping the mini-map at the targeted location.
In Blitz, tap once to select Card 1. Tap once more to play that card.
In Blitz, tap once to select Card 2. Tap once more to play that card.
In Blitz, tap once to select Card 3. Tap once more to play that card.
In Blitz, tap once to select Card 4. Tap once more to play that card.
In Blitz, tap once to select the card assigned to %1. Tap once more to play the card assigned to %1.
Queue movement, attack or interaction commands.
Shortcut key for unqueuing radial slot 1
Shortcut key for unqueuing radial slot 10
Shortcut key for using radial slot 10
Shortcut key for using radial slot 1
Shortcut key for unqueuing radial slot 2
Shortcut key for using radial slot 2
Shortcut key for unqueuing radial slot 3
Shortcut key for using radial slot 3
Shortcut key for unqueuing radial slot 4
Shortcut key for using radial slot 4
Shortcut key for unqueuing radial slot 5
Shortcut key for using radial slot 5
Shortcut key for unqueuing radial slot 6
Shortcut key for using radial slot 6
Shortcut key for unqueuing radial slot 7
Shortcut key for using radial slot 7
Shortcut key for unqueuing radial slot 8
Shortcut key for using radial slot 8
Shortcut key for unqueuing radial slot 9
Shortcut key for using radial slot 9
Reset the camera rotation and zoom level.
While holding down this key, enable camera rotation and zoom with the mouse and scroll wheel.
Scroll the camera down using fast camera movement.
Scroll the camera left using fast camera movement.
Scroll the camera right using fast camera movement.
Scroll the camera up using fast camera movement.
Select the units assigned to Control group 1. (Blitz)
Select the units assigned to Control group 10.
Select the units assigned to Control group 1. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Select the units assigned to Control group 2. (Blitz)
Select the units assigned to Control group 2. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Select the units assigned to Control group 3. (Blitz)
Select the units assigned to Control group 3. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Select the units assigned to Control group 4. (Blitz)
Select the units assigned to Control group 4. (Campaign, Multiplayer)
Select the units assigned to Control group 5.
Select the units assigned to Control group 6.
Select the units assigned to Control group 7.
Select the units assigned to Control group 8.
Select the units assigned to Control group 9.
Select the units assigned to control group %1.
Switch Fog of War viewing mode
Sub-select the next unit type from within the current selection.
Sub-select the previous unit type from within the current selection.
Tap to activate a selected unit type's ability. Hold to activate the abilities of all selected unit types.
Give a unit a movement, attack or interaction command.
Toggle the permanent display of hitpoint bars for every unit and building. Hitpoint bars show how much damage a unit or building has taken.
Adjust the overall brightness of the game.
Change the display mode of the game. Windowed modes may negatively affect performance.
Define the level of detail on all particle effects.
Adjust the quality of the foliage in game or turn it off.
Change the display mode of the game. Windowed mode may negatively affect performance.
Set the overall graphics quality. Affects all the advanced settings below.
Adjust values until the inside and outside are the same brightness
Adjust the level of detail in game.
Set the how detailed the lighting is, with higher settings including more light sources.
Adjust the model quality and details.
Determine the quality of depth of field and other effects.
Set the display resolution of the game that matches the aspect ratio of your monitor. Lowering this can improve performance.
Set the display resolution and aspect ratio of the game. Lowering this can improve performance.
Enable or disable screen space reflections.
Set the complexity of the shaders. This will have an impact on visual quality and performance.
Adjust the resolution of shadows in the game. Higher values will make them sharper and more defined at the expense of performance.
Determine the level of detail of the shadows.
Set the level of detail of the terrain.
Set the level of detail of the terrain.
Disable or adjust the level of texture filtering in the game.
Define the clarity and size of textures used. Higher settings required a video card with more RAM.
Synchronize the game's frame rate with your monitor's refresh rate.
Enable a closer view on the minimap; gain more detail at the expense of scope.
Change your mouse and keyboard settings.
Watch the Halo Wars 2 tutorial video.
Are you sure you want to resign?
Are you sure you want to restart the mission?
View the credits for the game
View and change the options for the game.
View and modify options for the game
Find a route to the Cartographer
Get to the Cartographer Map Room
Fight your way to the last portal
Protect Professor Anders at all costs
When a base is visible, press Alt + [Number] to build on empty plots or access constructed buildings.
Leader Power: Cancel Power Radial Menu: Cancel production
Leader Power: Use Power Radial Menu: Queue production
Click outside Radial Menu to close it.
[F1-F4] Select saved location + Ctrl: Save location
[ARROW_KEYS] Camera movement + Shift: Quick camera movement
With unit selected: Move to location Attack enemy unit Capture Tactical Point Garrison location
When over Minimap: Left-click: Move camera to location Right-click: Issue order
[ALT] + Mouse: Rotate camera + Mouse wheel: Zoom camera
Handled by marquee-selection, i.e. holding left-click, dragging the mouse over units and then releasing the mouse button Double left-click selects all units of the selected type.
Primary Select (Double-click) Select units of same type (Click empty space) Deselect
Scroll: Cycle unit selection Scroll + Alt: Zoom camera

Ctrl + 1 to 0: Assign unit(s) to a new Control Group Shift + 1 to 0: Add/remove unit(s) to existing Control Group Tap 1-0: Select Control Group/nDouble-tap 1-0: Select and focus camera on Control Group Shift + Left-click: Add to currently selected units
LEVEL I Drops a cluster of cloaked mines onto the battlefield.
LEVEL I Drops a temporary turret into battle.
Pre-order Halo Wars 2 or Halo Wars 2: Ultimate Edition
Setting up a deck for Blitz
Preparing for a Blitz Private Match
Players you recently encountered online will be listed here.
Add some Friends to see them listed here.
Unlock by progressing through the Campaign.
Atriox charges two Brute brothers, Voridus and Pavium, to salvage weapons from the High Charity crash site.
Voridus and his team unleash the deadliest threat the Ark has known.
Voridus and Pavium nervously await the judgement of Atriox after the destruction of the Proto-Gravemind.
After twenty-eight years in cryosleep, the crew of the UNSC Spirit of Fire awake to a mysterious distress signal.
On the Spirit of Fire, Isabel tells Captain Cutter about the new threat of Atriox and his Banished.
As the Spirit of Fire comes under attack by the Banished supercarrier, desperate plans are put into action by Isabel, Anders, and Captain Cutter.
Spartan Jerome protects Isabel as they enter the Banished supercarrier and awaken a power even more dangerous than the Banished.
Witness the climax of the battle to control the new Halo ring.
Red Team investigate a seemingly abandoned human outpost, where they rescue a new ally and make a powerful new enemy.
After being transported through slipspace on the new Halo ring, Anders encounters a startling new threat.
Looking for a greater challenge or struggling with the objectives? Try adjusting your difficulty.
Research Advanced Logistics from the Armory to reduce unit training times.
Use air units to counter deployed enemy artillery.
The Airpad is home to global upgrades that increase the health and damage of all your air units.
Artillery deployed in locations that are hard for the enemy to reach can wreak havoc on their forces.
The Banshee is a fast-moving, Banished air unit that can harrass unprepared troops. Wolverines are an effective counter.
The Blisterback is a Banished heavy air unit that can deploy to the ground to unleash artillery attacks.
When deployed into artillery mode, Blisterbacks are susceptible to ground attacks.
The bottom left of your screen shows your D-pad shortcuts. If you hold the Right Trigger, it shows your Control Groups.
Build turrets around your base to defend it from enemy forces.
A calm leader is a wise leader. Consider taking a break to adapt your strategies between matches.
If you capture and hold all Control Towers, you'll earn points at an accelerated rate.
If your team-mates make mistakes during a multiplayer match, provide civil feedback to help them help you.
Your units can see further when standing at the edges of cliffs. They can't be seen or attacked by enemies below.
Don't forget to spend your Leader Points using the Leader Tree.
The Condor is the UNSC's most powerful unit. Control the air with this slow-moving gunship.
Assign units to control groups to make handling your units easier. Create groups by holding down @D-Pad@ with @Right_Trigger@ held down.
Assign units to control groups to make handling your units easier. Create groups by holding down CTRL and pressing 1-0.
Infused pools can be ignited using Cataclysm to damage enemies.
Use units like the Infused Engineer or powers like Infusion Wake to create patches of damaging and slowing Infusion.
Surprise your enemy with an early attack if they concentrate too heavily on economy or tech.
Some well-timed defenses will defeat an enemy who tries to surprise you with an early attack.
Expand across the map or tech-up if your enemy is defending too heavily.
The Cyclops is a strong counter to enemy vehicles.
Units that can detect can spot cloaked units or mines.
Every unit has a counter. Diverse forces are harder to neutralize.
Don't stockpile resources - spend them on core units if you're unsure.
Always look for things to do with your armies. You paid for them - don't leave them idle.
Don't leave deployed artillery units undefended. They won't last long on their own.
Be careful not to rely only on counter units - they have their weaknesses.
Easy victories aren't always the best victories. Try different tactics even in victory.
Elite Rangers are the Banished's elite, Anti-Infantry units. Armed with carbine rifles, they are devastating at range.
Engage Sentinels one at a time from range to minimize damage received.
Engineers are Banished support units that heal friendly troops. Destroy them first to make fights easier.
Hold down @TutCamSpeed@ to enable fast camera movement.
Watch out, Flood spawners will create counters to your current array of units!
Order all units to attack a single unit at a time. You'll find this more effective than spreading out your damage.
Research Fortify Base from the Armory to increase the health of your buildings and increase turret damage.
The Garage is home to global upgrades that increase the health and damage of all your vehicles.
Use your @D-Pad@ often to jump between your bases, armies, and alerts. This is much quicker than moving manually.
Use the @TutCyclBses@, @TutCyclSquds@, and @TutCyclAlrts@ keys often to jump between your bases, armies, and alerts.
When you have 4 units of one type, a global upgrade may be more impactful than training another unit.
The global upgrades for Barracks, Garage and Airpad will increase the health and damage for Infantry, Vehicles and Air units.
If you capture and hold all the Strongholds for a minute, you'll win the match early.
Lead a fight with Holo-Decoys to draw fire away from your real units.
Don't forget Holo-Decoys can be used for scouting as well as distraction in fights. Keep you troops safe, use decoys!
The Hornet is effective against vehicles like the Wraith.
Kodiaks need to be deployed using @special_power@ to fire artillery shells.
Want a bigger army? Increase the population capacity of your army by upgrading it in the Armory or War Council.
Only infantry can capture and de-capture Control Towers and resource nodes.
Three isn't always a crowd. Have two friends join you in matchmaking for maximum mayhem!
The Jackrabbit is a fast-moving, scout unit. It's perfect for gathering information on enemy activity and quickly escaping.
Jackrabbits are non-combative scouts. Research the Mini-Frag Launcher if you want them to help in a fight.
Jump pack Brutes rapidly close in on targets with long-range jumps and deal melee damage.
The Kodiak is a long-range, artillery unit. Remember to deploy them (@special_power@) to fire artillery shells.
Leader Powers need to recharge before being used.
Areas targeted by enemy Leader Powers will be telegraphed by ground indicators. Clear the area before they hit.
The Lich Vanguard can produce units and comes equipped with powerful weapons, perfect for locking down crucial areas.
Press @TutLClUnits@ to select all the units you see on your screen. Double-tap @TutLClUnits@ to select all units in the game.
Press @TutLClUnits@ to select the units you see on screen. Press @TutAllUnits@ to select all of your units.
Lock down your HQ from its radial menu to hide units in production from the enemy.
The Locust is deadly against buildings. If the Banished deploy these against your base, respond with Cyclops or Hornets.
If you get along with a team-mate in multiplayer, add them to your Friends. Let war bring people together for a change.
Marauders are fast-moving, Banished light tanks.
Marines are soft-counters to air units.
Mega Turrets have a very long range, make the most of them by providing vision for them with units or the Orbital Designator power.
Reavers are anti-air units, making them good counters to flying Sentinel units.
The minimap is your best friend. Use it to keep track of the battlefield.
Make sure you're earning enough resources to support your spending.
Nightingales are UNSC support units. They have no weapons, but they will heal your units and keep them alive.
Use the Orbital Designator to get early intel on the enemy so you can respond immediately.
Orbital Designator II greatly weakens the defense of enemy forces under its gaze.
Burnout is a very flexible leader power. Use it to speed up unit and resource production, or to boost your turrets' damage.
If you find a particular tactic isn't working as well, the game balance may have changed during a recent patch.
No mic? Click @Left_Stick@ in a multiplayer game to ping your location on your teammate's minimap.
No mic? Press @Ping@ in a multiplayer game to ping your location on your teammate's minimap.
Power capture points provide a valuable source of power income to your entire team.
A captured Power node gives the same amount of Power to everyone on your team, regardless of who captured it.
Try to predict and counter your opponent's next move before it happens.
Reavers are deadly against your air units. Destroy Reavers before moving air units into an area.
Be sure to use your recon teams to scout and scan for threats and useful areas.
The bottom radial option on the HQ radial will recycle your base. This is a risky opening move and is not advised.
Destroy red barrels to kill nearby enemies with the explosion.
Research Reinforcements I from the Armory to increase the maximum population to 100.
Don't be afraid to pull injured units out of a fight to heal them.
In most situations, Vehicles will defeat Infantry, Air will defeat Vehicles and Infantry will defeat Air units.
Cards have different Energy costs. A balanced deck mixes both low and high cost cards.
Inspect cards in your Card Library to get more details on how their Keywords work.
Air units and units with Deployment Fatigue cannot collect Energy cells.
If you have a card you don't need, Cycle it to draw a new card.
If a strategy isn't working, try swapping new cards into your deck.
Capture all 3 Control Zones to trigger Total Domination and speed up your scoring.
Complete daily and weekly Challenges to earn card packs and unlock new cards.
Claim Energy Cores to speed up your Energy rate and play more expensive cards.
New Energy Cores drop between waves. Don't forget to pick them up!
Claiming an Energy Core awards Energy to all team members.
Energy in Firefight is finite. Claim Energy Cores to play more cards.
Each player has their own Energy pool but Energy rate is team-based.
Unit cards refund some of their Energy cost on death.
Units with Deployment Fatigue have half health and deal half damage for 8 seconds.
Attack enemies with Deployment Fatigue to prevent their health recovery.
Units deployed in your Home Base are not affected by Deployment Fatigue.
Guard units are a strong counter to Blast units.
Heal your damaged units by sending them back to your Home Base.
Units with Keywords are generally more powerful than standard units.
Each Leader has unique cards that support their own battle strategies.
You can play cards anywhere you have line of sight.
Finding match-made games difficult? Try a Blitz Firefight versus the A.I.
Ready for a bigger challenge? Use Find Match to play against other players.
Rush units are good at contesting Energy Cores.
To score points you must control more Capture Zones than your opponent.
This tutorial will teach you how to play cards and win Blitz matches.
Practice playing Blitz in Firefight or challenge other players using Find Match.
Build your own deck of cards anytime from the Blitz main menu.
Regular Blitz matches have a 12 minute time limit.
Rotate your camera and adjust your zoom occasionally to get a different perspective on the battlefield.
The Scarab is the Banished's most powerful unit. Focus fire with everything you have to take it down.
The Scorpion is the UNSC's main battle tank. It's slow-moving but will deal heavy damage to infantry.
Counter-unit strategy is key. Be aware of the unit mix your enemy is using by scouting frequently.
Fast-moving scout units like Jackrabbits and Choppers can move quickly while firing. Keep moving them to avoid incoming fire.
Choppers, Ghosts and upgraded Jackrabbits are excellent at repelling rushes.
Counter-unit strategy is key. Send out scouts frequently to be aware of units your enemy is using.
Double-tap @TutSelect@ on any unit to select ALL units of that type on your screen.
Use the EMP Emitters to shut down Sentinel launching bays. Don't let them overwhelm you!
Made an awesome play or did something crazy? Record that and share the love!
The Shroud's ability can cloak friendly units for a short time. Use this when the enemy doesn't have any detectors in their army.
The siege turret is a long-range, artillery turret. Use these to soften up enemy units at a distance.
Use Paint Select (Hold @TutSelect@), Local Select (@TutLClUnits@), and All Units (Double-tap @TutLClUnits@) to make simple unit selections.
Use Paint Select (Drag-select), Local Select (@TutLClUnits@), and All Units (@TutAllUnits@) to make simple unit selections.
Snipers are Anti-Infantry units that can upgraded with Active Camo, but watch out for enemy detectors.
Press @Y_Button@ when a Sniper is selected to cloak it for a limited time.
Press @special_power@ with a Spartan selected to hijack and take control of enemy vehicles.
The Spartan slam (@special_power@) launches a devastating attack on ground units.
Units often have special abilities. Remember to press @special_power@ to use them.
Don't forget to spend your Leader Points in the Leader Radial.
Spend your resources as efficiently as possible. The bigger army often wins.
Split your units into small groups to reduce the effectiveness of enemy splash damage.
Study your Leader Power radial. Some Leader Powers have multiple upgrades that can be bought to make them stronger.
After selecting a group of units, press @Right_Trigger@ to cycle between unit types in that selection.
After selecting a group of units, scroll the mouse wheel to cycle between unit types in that selection.
Supply is mainly used for units and structures, while Power is usually used for upgrades and increasing your HQ tech.
The rate at which Supply is gathered from crates and Supply buildings are almost equal.
Nightingales, Shrouds and Engineers are support units and don't have weapons. They're lovers, not fighters.
If you're losing too many units, consider training some Nightingales or Engineers to accompany your forces.
Ultra Mines are an exceptional defensive tool, use them often to devastate incoming enemy forces.
Each unit's role is explained below its name in the radial menu and in the selection bar at the bottom of the screen.
When ordered to move, your units will automatically attack enemy units but will keep moving to their destination.
Highly upgraded units can overcome their counters. Spend your Power wisely so that you don't fall behind on upgrades.
Every unit has a counter. Diverse forces are harder to neutralize.
Grunts can be upgraded to use Shrapnel Mines. These can be used to defend choke points effectively.
Research the Dispersion Nozzle upgrade for Hellbringers to add residual damage to their flamethrowers.
Research the Wingmen upgrade for Hornets at the Airpad to add Marines with rocket launchers.
Increase your HQ Tech from the top of the HQ radial to unlock advanced units and upgrades.
Research Combat Tech from the HQ to enable Marines to repair vehicles, buildings and air units.
Research the Grenade upgrade for Marines from the HQ to unlock the ability.
Research the Canister Shell upgrade for Scorpions in the Garage to unlock the ability (@special_power@).
Upgrade Supply and Power buildings to make them more efficient at producing resources.
Base turrets can be upgraded to improve their damage against infantry, vehicles or air units.
Build turrets and upgrade them with anti-air weaponry if enemy air units are harrassing your base.
Upgrade turrets with anti-vehicle weaponry if enemy vehicles are harrassing your base.
Leader powers can change the course of a fight. Spend those points and use those powers.
The Vulture is a powerful, UNSC heavy air unit, equipped with Phoenix Tactical Missiles that can be deployed with @special_power@.
Press @special_power@ to use the Warthog's Ram ability to deal immediate damage to infantry.
Warthogs are fast-moving and effective counters against infantry.
Build Watchtowers in the turret slots around your base to increase vision range and stealth detection in the area.
A lot of love, sweat and tears went into making Halo Wars 2. Share your love and feedback on Halo Waypoint.
Wolverines are the perfect counter to enemy air units.
Wolverines and Reavers can attack ground units, but don't rely on them to spearhead an assault against a ground force.
Cut through your foes with ease and revel in your unstoppable onslaught. Recommended for players new to Onslaught. Icon made by William from Pixelflare.
Recommended for players who have mastered Halo Wars 2.
Face insurmountable odds and an overwhelming enemy force. This is what legends are made of. Icon made by William from Pixelflare.
The enemy will not relent, but a considered strategy should earn you a victory. Recommended for players with RTS experience. Icon made by William from Pixelflare.
Heroes are powerful units! Use Heroes effectively to turn the tide of battle.
Learn how to play the Blitz strategy card game with a quick practice match.
